匕 (an ancient type of spoon, dagger/ladle)
mng: fart, flatulence, nonsense, (usu. in the negative) what, (not) a damn thing

exm.mng: fart, flatulence, nonsense, (usu. in the negative) what, (not) a damn thing
to fart, to break wind, to talk nonsense, Utter rubbish!
to flatter, to fawn on, to butter sb up, toadying, boot-licking
lit. bum beetle, sb who tags along, shadow, sycophant
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
lit. to take off trousers to fart, fig. to do something absolutely unnecessary, fig. to make things too complicated
erhua variant of 屁眼[pi4 yan3]
to tag along behind, to follow sb closely
